title: Capstone: Ship Your AI Product
description: Design, build, deploy, and launch your own AI product from start to finish
learningObjectives: Apply product thinking to identify and validate real problems
Implement AI features with best practices
Launch product and gather user feedback
overview:
This is your capstone project - the culmination of everything you've learned in the AI Product Builder curriculum. Unlike previous sprints with specific requirements, this project gives you creative freedom to build an AI product YOU want to exist.

You can choose from 4 curated project templates (recommended) or propose your own custom project. Each template provides guidance on AI techniques, features, and architecture while giving you room for creativity.

Your goal: Ship a real AI product that solves a real problem for real users.

productThinking: Validate problem with 5+ user interviews or research
Scope MVP ruthlessly (3-5 core features only)
architecture: Follow layered architecture (presentation, application, domain, AI services, infrastructure)
Implement error handling and retry logic
aiImplementation: Use Claude API or OpenAI API (or both)
technical: Database for persistence (Vercel Postgres, Supabase, etc.)
launch: Launch on at least 1 channel (Product Hunt, Twitter, etc.)

templateSelection.description: Choose from 4 curated templates or propose your own

templates.description: Help users write better content faster

templates.name: Creative AI Tool
templates.description: Story generator, idea brainstormer, or creative assistant

requirements: Submit 1-page project proposal with problem, solution, features
Must use AI (LLM) as core feature, not just add-on
Scope must be achievable in 30-40 hours

deliverables: User research (5+ interviews or secondary research)

successCriteria.description: Solves real problem, polished UX, reliable AI features
Clean architecture, proper error handling, well-tested
Effective prompts, cost optimization, quality outputs
Public launch, clear docs, demo video, portfolio-worthy

rubric.exceeds: Product solves clear problem validated by users, excellent UX, robust AI implementation with cost optimization, comprehensive monitoring, successful public launch with user feedback, portfolio-quality showcase
rubric.meets: Product addresses real problem, functional UX, working AI features, deployed to production with basic monitoring, public launch, good documentation
rubric.approaching: Product idea is interesting but problem validation weak, basic functionality works, AI features inconsistent, deployed but limited monitoring, minimal documentation
rubric.incomplete: Problem unclear, core features don't work reliably, not deployed to production, or no public launch

resources.templates: See templates/ directory for detailed project templates

required: Brief write-up (200-300 words): problem, solution, tech choices, learnings

tips: Start with user research, not technology - validate the problem first
Scope ruthlessly - ship 3 great features, not 10 mediocre ones
Use existing UI components (shadcn/ui) to focus on AI features
Deploy early and often - don't wait for perfection
Get real user feedback within first 2 weeks
Track costs from day 1 - implement caching early
Build in public - share progress on Twitter for accountability
Focus on one great demo - quality over quantity
commonPitfalls: Scope creep - trying to build too many features
Skipping user research - building features nobody wants
Poor prompt engineering - inconsistent AI outputs
No cost monitoring - unexpected $500 API bills
No error handling - app crashes on API failures
Weak product positioning - unclear value proposition
Skipping launch - not getting product in front of users
